Title: Neural Point Process for Learning Spatiotemporal Event Dynamics
Description: The paper "Neural Point Process for Learning Spatiotemporal Event Dynamics" introduces DeepSTPP, a model for predicting irregular spatiotemporal events. Unlike traditional models focused on time, DeepSTPP combines spatial and temporal dynamics using a nonparametric space-time intensity function governed by a latent process. It employs amortized variational inference with deep networks to capture event uncertainty. Experiments on synthetic and real-world datasets show that DeepSTPP outperforms state-of-the-art models in forecasting spatiotemporal events.

Title: Earthquakes
Description: The USGS Earthquake Catalog Search allows users to access detailed information on global seismic events. Users can filter earthquakes by parameters such as magnitude, date, location, depth, and more. The platform offers various output formats, including CSV, KML, QuakeML, and GeoJSON, facilitating data analysis and integration with other applications.

Title: Automatic Integration for Spatiotemporal Neural Point Processes
Description: The paper "Automatic Integration for Spatiotemporal Neural Point Processes" presents AutoSTPP, a framework for learning spatiotemporal point processes (STPPs) by addressing integration challenges in intensity functions. AutoSTPP extends dual network methods to 3D STPPs, using ProdNet's decomposable parametrization to handle computational complexity. It accurately recovers intricate intensity functions, especially for sharply localized events, as shown in experiments on synthetic and real-world datasets.

Title: COVID-19 cases
Description: The GitHub repository was established by The New York Times to provide comprehensive data on COVID-19 cases and deaths across the United States. It includes cumulative counts at national, state, and county levels, along with rolling averages and data on mask usage.

Title: Contextâ€‘aware spatiotemporal event prediction via convolutional Hawkes processes
Description: The paper "Context-aware Spatio-temporal Event Prediction via Convolutional Hawkes Processes" introduces ConvHawkes, a model that improves traditional Hawkes processes by integrating convolutional neural networks to include external contextual factors, such as population density and weather, into spatio-temporal event predictions. This approach improves predictive accuracy by utilizing unstructured data like satellite images.
